values:
I can't believe it's been so long since I've posted. Blame it on being a mom.  I still don't have the hang of my days.  Or I should say, I don't have control of my schedule yet.  Baby Bee is in charge! 

House news--- it's back to painting.  I wish that I would just finish all the rooms in my house in one summer instead of just painting one or two.  It's taking a long time to finish.  This summer's plans are the kitchen cupboards and the den.. :)  Someday my bedroom will be done.

it's amazing to me that i haven't updated this in such a long time.  where did all the time go?

I am a very pregnant lady-38 weeks along now.  It seems so crazy--me..38 wks pregnant.  Now Ck and i are just waiting for the little man to make his debut.  We can't wait to meet him. It might sound all cliche, but we are already so in love with this little boy.  Everything that we've bought for him has been carefully chosen and thought out.  His room is so beautiful.  The only things left to do are to hang some things on his walls.  All of his clothes are washed and folded carefully in his baskets.  All separated by size, item, etc.  You can't have onesies with pj's, dontcha know?! :)  At night when I should be sleeping I am instead thinking of what my life is going to be like as a mom. thinking about what i want to teach him, how i want to be, all the dreams and aspirations i have for him.

in other news.. we have a little kitty. Well, technically she's not little. She's 3 yrs old. Meowie. named because she loves to "talk".... she is tiger-striped and very lovey. She was abandoned and lived on our deck.  Once we fed her and let her inside, she "adopted" us formally.  A trip to the vet's office got her all squared away.. shots were administered, flea medicine was given, tests were done, and it was all pronounced... that the kitty now belongs to us. Ck has never really cared for cats, but he adores Meowie. he's the one who always wants to buy her a toy or treat.  She spends her days outside and snuggles with us on the evenings until we go to bed.. for now the arrangement is satisfactory to all of us.  Probably in the winter we will transistion her to a full-time indoor cat.  She loves to snuggle and sleep.

hopefully this will be updated very soon.....

Poor forgotten blog. Working full-time and being pregnant leaves me exhausted at night and the blog is suffering as a result.

Found out on Friday that we are having a little boy.  A little boy!! Wow!  It's so exciting to finally know.  Now we can buy baby things.  So far we bought a few outfits, a baby book, and his first blankie. His blankie is amazing. It's so soft, I just love it.

This weekend we are planning to go to Chicago to do some major shopping.

I guess the nesting bug has hit me. I've got new curtains for my dining room, finally hung pictures up on walls, rearranged furniture in rooms, and have been getting rid of things like crazy. It's like I can't get rid of enough stuff. Sadly, this purging hasn't extended to my scraproom yet.  Supplies are plentiful in there.

My clothes all fit me really badly now.  My stomach is the only part that's really grown during my pregnancy.  Although I haven't gained much weight, my tummy looks like it has a soccer ball in it.

I am so excited these days.  Just loving life.

How far along? 16 weeks

Total weight gain/loss: I'm down 15lbs from my pre-pregnancy weight. Fine with me!

Maternity clothes? Not yet! :)

Stretch marks? Nope

Sleep:Barely sleeping at all.  I have horrible insomnia, but I am exhausted all the time It's not fair.

Movement: I don't know it I'm feeling anything.  My tummy is always rumbly and bumbly these days. People describe the movement as feeling like a butterfly in your tummy or gas, but I wouldn't know how to distinguish what's going on in my tummy to say that it's the baby or not.

Food cravings: Water w/ lemon.  Apples

Best moment this week: Not throwing up for two days!!!!!  :)

What I miss: Sleeping on my tummy

Baby gender prediction:  Not a single clue.  I wish I had that "sixth" sense to instinctively tell me.

i had a great day out of the house planned for today.  i've been a recluse all week staying home and have soo much that needs to be done. i had planned on finishing up some holiday shopping, taking ck a pie and coffee for his team, and even going out to lunch.  i mentally prepared myself trying to block the idea of smells from my mind.  it didn't go so well. 

i went to best buy to get ck some dvd and cd for christmas. waited in line for 1 hr.  felt hot and sick.  and nauseous.  must everyone wear so much perfume & cologne?  ugh.  I was gasping for fresh air the second i left that place.  went and picked up the pie and coffee.  had to pull over off the 6lane road to whip open my car door and vomit profusely on the road.  my humiliation didn't end there.   i had to pull over 4 more times before i made it to ck's work.  he was very concerned.. told me that i should go home.  so i did.  after pulling over many more times on the way home to get sick.  no lunch. no library. no shopping.  i came home a dizzy mess. had to lay down on the floor for awhile.

i've never felt so tired and sick in my whole life.  i am amazed that women can handle all this.  my sister is pregnant with her 4th baby, for goodness sakes, and I am barely making it through one.  i worry about how i'm going to handle having a job when i can barely go to the grocery store. my hope is that sooon, very, very soon this sickness will go away so that i can live a normal life. 

got my final grades yesterday.. very pleased with them. i graduated with an overall gpa of 3.85!!!  Yippee!!!!  (3.85 out of 4.0)
i ended up better than i thought i would.

watched a scary ass "baby story" yesterday. note to self... stay far away from those shows, you really dont' want to know what the labor process is like. must remain in denial... :)

I can't believe that next week is Christmas!!  it's crazy.  Of course I haven't finished my shopping yet.  Mainly because of the violent reaction my stomach has when I'm around people wearing heavy perfume or cologne. Ugh.  One wiff and I'm done.  I also can't stand the smell of fast foods or many foods at all for that matter.  Ugh.  My doctor told me that 90% of women stop experiencing sickness in the second trimester, which I've just arrived in, so I'm hopeful that my tummy will soon settle down.  it seems like the sickness gets worse every day.

I had my first sonogram. It was truly magical.  I had thought that the baby would look like a little pea or something, but surprisingly it looked like a real baby!  It jumped around the entire time of the sonogram.  We got to hear the heartbeat and it was amazing.  Ck and I were both awestruck by it all.  Suddenly it became so real that we are having a baby & that's so huge.

Other news.... I graduated on Saturday!!!!  Amazing!!!  

Happy Holidays everyone!

• it's amazing how long it's been since i've updated this.  i blame my absence on taking so many classes, getting ready to graduate, and dealing daily with sheer exhaustion and stomach aches.  i feel the worse in the mornings and at night when i try to go to sleep. i get horrible heartburn and can't get to sleep.
    • tomorrow i have yet another doctor's appointment schedule.  i have had two previously scheduled, only to be cancelled both times by the clinic. the first cancellation resulted from fumes shutting down the building. the second cancellation happened from the horrible ice and snow storm that hit the midwest last week. i really hope that i can actually go to tomorrow's appointment. 
    • there are still many people who don't have electricity here yet.
    • i graduate next saturday.. amazing
    • i have finals next week
    • yesterday a disaster happened when my cell phone fell out of my coat pocket and into some slush.  it won't work now. i'm really hoping that it will when it dries out.  stupid college that doesn't ice sidewalks well and forces people to slip and cell phones fall out of coats.
    • i don't have anyone's phone numbers now.. i don't memorize numbers, just program them in my phone. i had to send out a begging email asking people to send me their numbers. ugh. this time i'm going to go to verizonwireless.com and do the whole free backup thing so i will always have a copy of people's phone numbers regardless of the status of my phone. i feel like such a dork.
    • have decided to forego christmas lights this year.  don't want to pollute baby invitro with lead lights and lead dust. ck and i have been desperately trying to find american-made lights so they won't have lead, but can't find any.

-martha stewart has a new book out... It's a housekeeping book. Ck bought it for me over the weekend. I A-b-s-o-l-u-t-e-l-y love it!!!  Martha has really out done herself!  It's an awesome book!

-i have been feeling very, very ill. I thought I had contracted a foul, evil form of food poisioning from spinach.  much to my utter surprise.. i found out that i am pregnant!  a very surprise pregnancy. i tend to like a very well-planned out life, but sometimes life throws things that you can't plan.  after a few days of initial shock... the idea that we are going to be parents is slowing sinking in. we've been looking at books and looking at baby things.  but i am still so overwhelmed by everything.  i need help!! i don't know anything about being a parent or having a child. 
-my s

-i had a job interview today! it went really well!  I have my second interview in a few weeks. I can't wait to be able to say that I have a full-time job. I'm going to have a 401k., insurance, holiday and vacation pay, retirement savings, all that good stuff.

-Watching the movie, Walk the Line, on HBO.  It's really good. I'm totally into it.  We have free HBO this weekend and I've been watching tons of movies.

-Read a really good book yesterday, The Last Templars. It was a great read.

-Have drank a ton of coffee today.

-Enjoying the Yankee candles, Autumn Wreath and Pumpkin Pie

-Had a great conversation w/ my friend Jen tonight. We've been friends forever.

I am totally psyched.  Today the Dow closed over 12,000!!!  How exciting!
I started becoming interested in the stock market with my first finance class eight million years ago.
I have a subscription to the Wall St. Journal newspaper.
I read it everyday.
I have called the Wall St. Journal and complained if my paper comes late or ruined.
I have bought the paper at the store when my carrier doesn't bring it at all.
I have a huge stack of newspapers in a basket in my living room.
I save articles I especially like in a binder.
I have given stock advice to others and they have earned money.
Did you know that Martha Stewart was once a stockbroker?
I have contemplated becoming a certified financial planner more than a million times.

I really, really love fall.. It's my absolute fave season.
  
Why am I procrastinating writing my term paper? Why?  I know I'll enjoy it, but I'm just having a tough time getting started.  Maybe it's because I have so many papers to write this semester?  

Grade-wise, I am doing fabulously so far. Thankfully.

Ck is in Pa doing some recruiting. He's having a good time. He did a bunch of interviews today & said he had a lot of great candidates.  He comes home on Saturday.

Jamie's mom gave me three ferns on Saturday. I transferred them to different pots and in plant stands. I just love them!  Ferns rock.  Now i have 5 ferns in my house.  All of them are Boston ferns.

I'm so tired.  Last night I stayed up way too late doing homework.

Senator Baraack Obama was on Oprah today.  He's an Illinois Senator.  While I think he's genuinely a great person and a good husband and father, I don't always agree with his voting record. Yes,I am a nerd and get copies of all Illinois Senators votes and Representative's votes.   And yes, again a nerd, I email the Senators all the time and let them know issues I am interested in.  I 99% of the time always agree with D. Durban's votes.  I think he is a great Senator.

Meeting Sarah tonight for dinner. I'm excited to see her, it's been awhile.  Since the summer, actually.

Peace out

yesterday it was 95 degrees here.  today it was 60.
typical crazy illinois weather.

the leaves are getting so pretty. i love fall!
i love candles.
pumpkin bread.
making stews.
wearing comfy clothes.
cleaning my house.

school is crazy!  tons of papers... tons of exams.. it's overwhelming.
thank goodness for my handy dandy planner. or i'd be hopelessly lost.

our deck is finally all stained. it looks great

what a week!!!  taking five classes is certainly no picnic.   i'm going to be so stinking grateful when december rolls in.  i mailed out my application for graduation a month ago.  i decided against participating in commencement.  I have already walked in one college graduation. I hate being the center of attention in a big arena.  At my first college graduation I remember feeling petrified back stage not wanting to have my name announced and have to walk across the stage in front of so many people.  Also, my last name is at the end of the alphabet. It takes forever to get to my name and sweltering in the gown for me is no fun.  soooo....  Ck said we can do whatever I want to do to celebrate the big day.  

Next weekend we are going on the Fall Foliage cruise that we won from Ck's work.  It's an all-day thing and should be lots of fun. I'm pretty excited.  

I love fall. Love cooler weather and changing leaves.

Sears is going to replace our refrigerator.  The ice maker has been just wrong for ages.  We've had approximately 6 appointments with the repair team where they have tried to fix it to no avail. yay for new frig

getting used to my school schedule is going to take some time. i'm taking more classes this semester than i'm used to.  Also the sheer volume of homework that i have is rather staggering.  implementing a good time management system will be a necessity for me to survive and be successful.  one of my classes is completely difficult.  i'm worried about my competency in it.  hoping all will go well and i can celebrate with a graduation in december.

it's been a rainy past few days here in the land of lincoln. i've been enjoying the chilly rains though. it's such a nice departure from the normally scorching temps that infuse this state.  the rain has made me enjoy drinking coffee and soups, to keep on schedule, and tidy my house with glee.

sooo thankful for the long weekend coming... love labor day.. ck and i are going to stain our deck. i'm excited. hate the color it is right now...

organizational strategy beacons me.. time to get back to work

why did it take me so long to discover the gilmore girls?
i caught an episode this summer quite accidentally. instantly i was hooked.
i have rented seasons 1-3 from blockbuster to catch myself up on the series from the beginning.
What a GREAT show!! I love it!  I've already told Santa that he can buy me the dvd's for Christmas. :)

This is my last week of freedom.  Monday starts the fall semester... My last semester of school.  I've submitted my application for December graduation. I've decided not to participate in commencement, but I will have a little celebration at my house. I'll invite a few close friends and make some yummy appetizers.

Speaking of my house..... The downstairs is all painted!!  It's been the summer of painting. 5 rooms!!!   Now all that's left is the garage, basement, and upstairs.  And the deck. Ck and I are going to start on the deck in a few weekends.

This Saturday we are going to Chicago to the Field Museum. We're going to see the King Tut exhibit. I'm super psyched!
I love going to the city and to museums.

i have an insatiable hunger for tomatoes and olives. not together, separately.

the weather is unbearably hot here.  the heat index was 113 degrees. ugh. i hate summer.

going to King Tut exhibit in Chicago next weekend.

Fall semester starts on Aug 19.

my summer finance class ends next thursday.

i had a crazy busy weekend.  mally's birthday party.  dinner with friends.  painted downstairs bathroom.  bookstore. worked.  farmer's market. laundry. cleaned house

ck and i had a busy, busy weekend.   on thursday night we went to see the documentary, An Inconvenient Truth.  It was wonderfully informative.  global warming scares me.   In my lifetime I can see how much the climate has already changed.  It troubles me.  I hate heat, humidity, and icky summer weather.  I'd be perfectly content to live in a fall-weather-all-year-round kind of place.

I worked on Saturday and then we went to a bbq & then a get-together.   It was fun.  But now I am tired.  My weekends are usually kind of leisurely. Ck and I like to hang out at bookstores.  Socializing is great, hanging out and meeting new people is great, but I'm one of those people who needs a lot of time to just putter around the house.  I love to clean & organize and watch tv.  For the past two straight weekends we have been very social and I think I need a bit of a small break.

when is this humid weather ever going to end? ugh!
many errands to do today

BLOOMINGTON - A Bloomington police sergeant accused of attempted burglary also is a suspect in a three-year series of unsolved rapes in which women living alone were attacked inside their homes, the officer's attorney and wife told the Pantagraph. Bloomington Sgt. Jeff Pelo, 41, is being investigated as a person police think may have raped up to four women - all single and in their 20s - since December 2002, defense attorney Steve Skelton confirmed. Pelo is jailed on charges of

• tonight ck and i are going to my friend sarah's graduation party.  i can't wait to see her.  my friend beth is now engaged and allie is pregnant.
  • ck and i went to see the pirates of the caribbean movie.  i didn't really care for it. it was too long and i wonder why some scenes weren't edited out. ugh.  definetely not my favorite movie i've seen this summer.  
  • i've started working at a homeless shelter on mondays, thursdays, fridays, and saturdays.  it's very fulfilling work.  my first few days i was really scared and unsure of myself, but the residents are great.  90% of them work full-time.  80% of them have children.  there are residents who are working 2 full- time jobs.  all of the stereotypes i previously held about homeless people were so wrong.  i'm learning so much
  • a heat wave has come to illinois.  it is miserable.

Congratulations to my beloved Danielle on the birth of her daughter Aislin...
She's beautiful and I am soo happy for you!
xoxo

the weather was unbearably hot today.  the kind of hot that drains your energy the second you go outside.  i can only sing praises for Central Air Conditioning. Without it, I would be a crazy mess. I'm not really a summer person. And Illinois is really super nightmarishly hot in the summer.

The 4th of July is fun.  it's all about watermelon, hot dogs, fireworks, cakes made with blueberries and strawberries, iced tea, picnics, monk marathons on usa, and all that jazz.  it's weird having the 4th on a Tuesday.

We're going to paint the front living room this weekend.  A beautiful lemony yellow.  i'm super psyched. it's going to look awesome!

finished one summer class.  exam 1:95, exam 2: 100, final: 97!!!!!!!!!  papers: all 100's, wall st. journal journal: 100.  Final Grade: A!!!!  :) 

Have officially started summer class #2.  It sucks!  It's an investments class.  My teacher is Chinese and almost impossible to understand.  i'm hoping i'll do okay. there is a ridiculous amount of homework assigned- about 20 hours worth per week.. ARGH!!!

is it friday yet???

hmm... yet another graceful moment has happened to me.  i went outside to mail a card and pick up the wall st. journal from my driveway.  i slipped on the driveway and a bloody mess ensued.  my feet went from normal feet to mangled bloody messes.  my driveway looked like either a 1) crime scene or 2) a horror movie set.   i tried to clean, neosporin, and bandage my feet rather unsuccessfully.  after much suffering for a few days i dragged my pain-ridden body to the doctor.

4 stiches, 1 tetnus shot, a zillion bandages, and one split later, i hobbled out of the clinic. argh.

i need to learn how to walk apparently.  who in the heavens falls down in their driveway and ends up with stiches?  :(

my most favorite treasures are things like:
-seashells
-a perfect rock
-a delightful scrapbook paper
- Longaberger catalogs
-watching the moon at night
-a star-filled nightsky
-a beautifully written book
-purses
-lemons
- pens
- a comfy sweater
- a great cd
- magazines

*for years ck and i have had the most wonderous mug. it's clear and round with the map of the world on it. a globe mug. it's the perfect size and fits into your hand perfectly. it's made by nestle. ck and i were venturing in an antique shop on saturday and what did we find..... 4 globe mugs all for the great price of $5 for the entire set. immediately we picked them up and declared that a treasured find had been found!!!! :) That $5 spent will bring years of happiness for us.

• Ck and I had a blast hiking at Starved Rock park today!!!  :)  
  • Home Depot opened a new store in our town. It's the bomb. We bought a book on Crown Molding. So excited to put it up in our rooms in our home. 
  • Love the da Vinci Code movie.. Love the book, love the movie
  • officially hate summer weather in illinois. unbearably hot and humid
  • can't wait to see a picture of angelina and brad's baby..
  • *must stop looking at longaberger catalogs.  it is crack to me
  • just read the alchemist by pablo coehlo.  truly magnificent book.. love love it.
  • not ready for week to start. if only weekends lasted 7 days. :)

i am so pleased that it is a long weekend. there are a million things that i need to get done.

last night we went to see the da vinci code. i really enjoyed the movie. i was so pleased that the character of sophie was played by the actress from Amelie.  I love that movie so much.

i have a pile of books to read.  i'm currently reading Goodnight Nobody by jennifer weiner and Anderson Cooper's book.  Anderson Cooper is my favorite reporter.

i've been addicted to popsicles lately.

sunshine and humid temperatures are here in illinois...

my week off proved to be very fruitful and productive...

-my kitchen that formerly was a combination of cobalt blue bottom wallpaper walls and the top half of the walls that had a combination of hearts, corn, and roosters.  gasp*  the designer of that wallpaper deserves a beating.  :)   Now my walls are a beautiful calm sage green..  Not too dark, not too light.  My kitchen is now serene and comfortable.  

- a crisis arose last week when i received a phone call from the university informing me that one of my needed classes is being cancelled. which would prolong the graduation until next may. i can't even tell you how many tears were shed, how many curse words were uttered, and how frustrated i felt.  but after a bunch of meetings and pleadings and my soul being sold (just kidding) the universe parted and is allowing my December graduation to happen. Whew!  I am soo thankful.  and relieved..

-Ck and I spoke about the impending wedding that will happen after i graduate.  Marriage!  :) 
We talked about flowers and outfits and words that we would like to be spoken.  I've once again begun buying wedding and bridal magazines.  I'm hoping the graduation will happen so that I can plan the wedding in more depth.  I've got a scrapbook of pictures I've cut out of magazines.  

-  We went to Jamie's community college graduation.  it was fun going out to eat with her family and watching her daughter during the day..  Jamie is such a wonderful person and a great friend.

-Ck and I are going to see the Da Vinci code on Thursday night. I'm super psyched. I love, love, love the book!!!!

- Yay that a long weekend is coming up

- started the first summer class. I really like it so far. I have an exam already next week.  My professor is awesome. she's originally from Pa and went to the same university as Maria!  cool!

*must get back to the reading of Chapter 3.... :)

one more final to go...
granted it's at 7 something tomorrow morning.
then another semester done.
a week off to remove wallpaper and paint
and relax and live like a normal person
before summer classes start.

poor neglected blog... 
i've been a very bad blog-keeper. my life has gone into crazy mode... can you tell it's almost time for finals? papers due, projects due, presentations presented.. exams.. quizzes.. it's crunch time.

last weekend, and i mean ALL weekend, ck and i tackled our dining room.
let's skip back to the BEFORE part... hmmm wallpaper.. two kinds of wallpaper separated in the middle with a border. I appreciate wallpaper, but not the stuff that was in my dining room. Ck and i decided to conquer our fear of removing wallpaper. You see, everyone has been telling us such horror stories about the removal of wallpaper that we've lived a whole year in this house with some pretty ugly wallpaper in some rooms. 

I have to tell you, readers, that all the horror stories of wallpaper removal were well-founded and not exaggerated at all. We were lulled into a false sense when the top portion of the wallpaper came off in no time at all, 15 minutes tops for the whole room. The bottom portion & border of the wallpaper weren't so generous. it took me 12 non-stop hours to remove PART of one wall. Skipping ahead, all in all it took 2 days just to remove wallpaper. Then we had to sand the walls. Prime the walls.. and finally Paint the walls. The results of all our hardwork really paid off though. Our dining room is gorgeous now!!! I selected a page out of Pottery Barn to use as Inspiration. (side note, Pottery barn catalogs are my CRACK). 

the page has an almost identical dining room table to ours in it. Armed with the page, I went to Benjamin Moore and brought home Chincilla blue paint for our dining room. It looks amazing! Now all our dining room needs is: new curtains, new chandelier, carpet removed, crown-molding put up, and some pictures hung on the walls. I can go into my dining room and feel such pleasure. I can see all my hard work went to creating a beautiful room. :)

My friend Jamie came over this morning and LOVES the room!! She couldn't stop saying such nice compliments.

Next up... removing the hideous chicken and heart patterned wallpaper in the kitchen. yes, chicken and hearts. it's revolting.

Spring is here.. finally.  robins are poking around lawns.. bunnies are out.. i love it!

ck and i went for a 2 mile long bike ride tonight. it felt great to be enjoying nature.

Is it spring or winter?  We have gobs of snow here. It's bitter cold. Colder than a few weeks ago.
Is Mother nature bi-polar?

it's spring break time here.... how've i been spending it???  I've been reorganizing closets, going through things and getting rid of stuff, reading boooks that aren't accounting ones, cleaning, doing laundry, watching tv.....  I love it!!  you would think that I'd be bored by now, but I'm not.  Not even close to bored.. i'm ready not ready to go back to school. I want to slow down time.. to make this week last longer.

Ck and I were going to go hiking tomorrow.. but the weather has taken a nasty cold turn again.  It's amazing how it can be 70 here during the day and then the next day the temp will be 20.. Totally unfair!!!

I went to Starbucks today. They were giving away free coffee from 10 am-noon.  i got a cup for ck too and surprised him at work. I also brought him  a piece of coffeecake. I'm such a good girlfriend.

i need to work on my scrapbooking.  where did my creativity go???

Ck and I wandered through a pet store a few weekends ago.  It was fun. We saw some awesome fish and birdies.  I started crying when I saw the little bunnies though. I miss Gretchen.  She was the best rabbit ever.  Maybe I should make a scrapbook tribute to gretchen.  I'm such a bunny person, but I don't ever think I can get another bunny.  Gretchie stole my heart bunny-wise.

I have been very unsuccessful tonight... Have been working dilligently since 7 pm on a tax research assignment.....
the site that i paid $200 to use keeps kicking me out...shutting down... rulings and procedures will show up only to dissappear seconds later. internal revenue codes are scrolling by about 200 miles per hour.
in short, the site is possessed by a devil... or that's what i'm thinking...
i'm ready, ready, super ready to pull my hair out.
now i just got a stupid message, after being kicked off the site, that i am logged onto the site and it won't allow multiple log-ins on different computers at the same time. that i'll have to wait till my session times out, in an hour, to resign in... ohhhh- and don't forget to sign out properly to avoid this.... SIGN OUT PROPERLY- I never signed out in the first place..#$%*! 
I hate this assignment.
I hate tax research assignments.
They suck.
I hate the website.
Hate the codes, rulings, legal opinions, rulings, and so on..
Oh, and Editorials- i hate you the most.  you secretly lure me into thinking that you are a primary source with your fancy words.. then after reading your boring diatributes on tax issues i realize you ARE A SECONDARY source.. thus USELESS TO ME!
god help me make it to spring break
serenity now.
oh, and thank you mr.managerial/cost/you suck teacher, for assigning me that project THAT'S DUE on WEDNESDAY.. thanks for assigning it today.. i'm not busy enough.. Let's see.. i've already got an 8 pg research paper due that day and a tax research assignment (that's killing me) due the same day.
i need to graduate.
i need to graduate

-Yesterday my Valentine surprised me with two dozen beautiful flowers.  The outsides of the roses are yellow and the insides are a melon-red color. They are simply stunning.  I am always so touched by Ck.  I bought Ck some chocolate and some truffles. He is a chocolate fiend. :-)  For dinner I made heart-shaped pizzas that turned out perfectly. I have been searching for heart-shaped pizza pans for years, and luckily found some at Target.  Yay!
- On Saturday Ck and I are going to Jamie's house. We're going to have a Valentine dinner w/ Jamie and Mally. Should be lots of fun. I am in charge of bringing rolls and a dessert.  I need to look for a good dessert recipe on the internet.  I am clueless w/ desserts. :)
- Tomorrow i have a tax test.  I'm a little fretful. There is so much material that we're being tested over.
- Next week will be absolutely stressFUL!  I have three exams, one huge Accounting Fars assignment due, a Tax Return project, and a 8 pg paper!!!!!! A-R-G-H!!!  Super bad week.. Sometimes I believe that professors conspire to have everything due at the same time..  And my belief has also been suggested by many of my friends who agree that there is indeed some sort of conspiracy..  UGH!  I'll be holed up in my scraproom or the library most of the time... ugh.

sometimes i am such a knucklehead... last week i mailed 4 things in one day.. i got them back yesterday because weirdo me didn't even put down states or zipcodes. UGHHHHHH!!  People like me shouldn't have mail privileges. :)  I'm such a dork.  So i had to get different envelopes, address them properly, and send them on their merry way.  I felt like a first-class fool.  Sadly to note, this is not the first time i've done such a thing..

How it happens... well.. i have a list of birthdays, anniversaries, holidays, etc and i fill out the cards on my desk and i'll write the first name of the person whose card it is on the envelope.  later on i'll address, stamp, etc them.  but sometimes i leave out the critical step of writing the addresses..  i should do it all at once. after all, i put our (ck and my) address on the envelope as soon as i write the recipient's name. why don't i just do it all at once?

so glad it's the weekend.  i have to work on a tax return assignment and study for an exam, plus write an assignment to turn in on monday. it seems like i have too many things to do over the weekends and i can't do fun things like go to movies.

but.. that's about to change.. because.... i am going to GRADUATE in december!!!   WOW!!! major!

and then i'll get MARRIED!  and GET A REAL FULL-TIME JOB.... and prepare to take the CPA exam.. scary stuff.

• the parking situation at school is unbearable this semester.  more students must have gotten apartments and are driving to class.  average wait to get a spot= 30 minutes.  UGH!
  • love my tax class... i'm learning so much valuable information. it's my favorite accounting class that i've ever had.  i am seriously considering specializing in tax.
  • my finance class is soo boring. the prof is really nice though. it's in a huge auditorium and i hate being squished. there's probably 500 people in my class. it's really hard to pay attention.  i look around and see people im'ing on their laptops, playing games, reading magazines, sleeping.. you name it. 
  • i have a lot of projects and assignments this semester which means i have some leeway with exams, which is always a good thing.
  • it is very cold here today. the bitter cold that seeps into your bones and nothing willl warm you up.
  • ck is not feeling well.  an evil throat virus circulated through his work and he now is suffering..
  • how did i ever live without a pda?  a pocket-size wonder gadget.... has addresses, documents, word, excel, outlook, even games on it..  i got my palmone tungsten e2 practically for free because we bought our christmas tv at best buy and they sent us a coupon for the store. i barely paid anything for my new handy, favorite organizer pda.  i love it. it fits in my pocket and has everything in it.  prior to my palm i had a planner for home, a planner for bills, a school planner, and a personal planner. now i have everything in one little compact kit.. and it hooks right up to my laptop, so i can put anything on my computer onto my palm. i love it!!  i fully endorse that everyone needs a pda!!! they will change your life.
  • loving the gwen stefani song "luxurious" (even if i can't spell it correctly)
  • tea kettle is whistling.. time for some earl grey.
Today is my sister Mindy's birthday!!!!!  Happy birthday sis!  I love you!!!xoxo

well, tomorrow a new semester begins....  these are my classes: last management accounting class, last financial accounting class, buyer behavior, federal income taxation, business finance..  egats!  i bought my books and the total cost of all of them brought tears to my eyes.  i also realized that i am wasting my time going to school for accounting. i should be a textbook manufacturer instead..  i'd be richer than bill gates. :)

on friday jamie, ck and I went to Ikea and the Container store.  Good times!!  I saw sooo many goodies!! I just love those two stores.  And being in Chicago was so nice. I hadn't gone there in awhile.  Every time I am in the city I realized how much I would love to live there. Chicago is the best!

We ordered new furniture for our living room. It's all clean lines, simple. chocolate brown leather.  We are getting a chair & ottoman, and two couches.  We got an incredible discount on it all.  I'm going to put the red couch in the other living room.  Our house is slowly coming together. We have TONS of painting projects and wallpaper removals to go..   I'm loving how everything is coming together though.

P to the O'd at the post office.  I paid extra to mail a pkg to my sis in two days. Guess what, it didn't get there in two days.  so this is what I'm gonna do.. Tomorrow after class I'm taking my receipt and a print-out from my email showing that the assholes didn't get it there in two days.  and an apology and refund of $$ better happen. I've also written an email complaint to the POST master general fo the us.  I am so tired of dealing w/ postal issues.  I'll just start using ups or fedex if they don't get their jobs right.  assholes.  UGH.

Got my hair cut today.. It feels great!

It's a new year...  I love new years..  I firmly believe that anything can be changed, anything can be improved, anything can be renewed... new years bring new possibilities.. new opportunities to be savored.. new things to be learned.

i've been purging my life.. purging out things i don't need. it's amazing how closets can hide so many things. how i can hold onto so many useless papers and trinkets that i really don't need.  how i keep those jeans that i haven't worn in two years.  this year, 2006, i am all about simplicity..  what a lovely word that is.  i've been rearranging, rediscovering little treasures, renewing my mind. 

last summer i started feeling a bit depressed. no reason really as to why. just a little depressed. sadly it has lingered longer than i've wanted it to. i can happily say that i can feel that starting to shift away.  i'm starting to feel like myself again. to feel creative and hopeful and rejuvinated.  thank heavens. you see, a new year is so powerful. :-)

Happy 2006 to everyone.. May it be a wonderous year..

it's hard to believe it's almost christmas.  this year has flown by so quickly. i can't keep my bearings on dates.

my friend maria came to stay with us for a few days. it was so good seeing her.  the visit went by way too quickly though.  i wish she lived closer.

tomorrow ck's parents are coming.  i'm feeling a little nervous. worrying about everything- do i have enough towels, what do they eat, etc....  by nature I am a fretter, so this worrying is nothing new.

i haven't mailed out any gifts yet. working two jobs leaves very little time. i went to the post office the other day to mail out some stuff- waited in line forever and realized my lunch break was about to end. so i didn't get anything sent out.  i hope noone is upset w/ the late stuff. i wish that a] post offices were open longer b] i wasn't running around like crazy c] next year i'll have all my shopping done by november so i can mail everything out early.  with the demands of school, work, and taking care of a house i'm not sure how i can pull c] off.

i'm tired.. still have to do laundry and a zillion other things... ugh

The fall semester is finally come to a screeching halt.  It ended with the most difficult final I've ever had the displeasure of taking. UGH. at 7:50 am i suffered through a painfully hard exam.  after completing it and walking down the hall of the college of business, i realized that the semester had officially ended for me. but i didn't feel any relief from that fact. instead i felt dread and apprehension. i worked more dilligently this semester than ever before.  often spending 8 hours a night at the library and oddily enough it's the semester that i did the worst in..  the cost/benefit analysis that i do doesn't add up.

  Those semesters of row's of perfect A's has ended, I do believe.  My academic advisor told me that employers really don't want to hire people with straight A's because they worry that they will burn out.  I think she was just telling me that to make me feel better as I prepare for all B's and a lone A.  UGH! I just don't understand what I could have done better. But I need to distract my mind from this consuming thing...

other news... My SIS Had her BABY!!!  She had another girl. She named the new bundle- Arianna Caitlyn. Ari was born on Pearl Harbor day. She's a little baby weighing 6 lbs and 10 oz at birth and was 20 inches "tall".   My sis says that Ari has blond hair.  She just sounds so adorable.  I really want to meet Ari and to see Nellie and Vallie.  I miss my family.  The last time I saw them was a sad time with my grams being ill and going to heaven. I want to see my family as a happy occasion.  I should plan a trip.

other news.... Ck and I got our tree. It's a basalm (balsam?) fir. it's tall and smells heavenly.  we got decorations .. tonight will be tree trimming night.  we'll listen to the cd "Charlie Brown Christmas" as we decorate. I am super excited...

maria will be here on saturday for four days. i can't wait to see her. the day she leaves ck's parents are coming to stay. which means, we'll have guests for the holidays. our first holiday guests ever. i am extremely nervous worrying about every stinking detail. i need to just relax, it will be fine. i worry too much.

over break i'll be doing a temporary job at an insurance company doing some tax auditing.

today i plan on doing laundry, reading "memoirs of a geisha".. relaxing. no more finals. no more assignments... can finally finish christmas shopping. can decorate.  can do all the many things i've been aching to do all semester when i had to study.. i will get more than 3 hours of sleep a night. i won't be at the library more than i'm at home.

i'm worn out. bubble bath- rescue me.

• ck and i are venturing to indiana this weekend.  we are going to an outlet mall shopping. i'm super psyched.  my sis asked me to buy the neices clothes for xmas. the outlet mall has a carter's store, gap kids, old navy kids, osh kosh, and soo many more.   i'm also very excited to also see that there is a coach store, a crate & barrel, le cruset, and burberry.  i only wish we had rocking stores like that here.
  • currently on last week of classes.  have finals next week
  • maria is flying into illinois next saturday. super excited to see her
  • it's snowing outside
  • i didn't sleep well last night.. ugh!
  • have begun decorating for christmas.  hung up a wreath, some bows, stockings.  :)  getting a tree this weekend.  super excited about that!
  • sis (Min) hasn't had new baby yet.  i am sooo excited for new baby to come. i haven't bought anything for new baby yet, waiting to find out if it's a boy or a girl. so far my family thinks it's a boy...
  • love our new tv.  it's amazing how different things look.
  • it is very cold here, only 7 degrees
  • need to finish filling out christmas cards

This has been a busy week.  On Monday I gave my presentation in MQM.  It went well.  I am so thankful to be done with that. I'm not overly fond of public speaking.  I hope I get a good grade on it.  I've been studying, studying, studying all week.  Last night Danielle and I spent 3 hours doing homework for int accounting class.  We are getting together again tomorrow to do another chapter.  Then on Sunday I'm meeting all the girls to do Cost accounting. UGh!! But the good news is that I only have one more week of classes. Then a week of finals. Then I'm done.. :)

My friend Maria is coming to stay for 4 days after my finals. We're gonna go shopping, do some scrapbooking, sightsee in Chicago, etc.  I'm really excited that she's coming to stay.

My sis, Min, hasn't had her baby yet.  I am so excited to see if she has a boy or a girl.

Ck and I made a wreath last weekend.  We went to Hobby Lobby and they had dried naturals and wreath stuff all on sale for 50% off so we picked up a bunch of stuff. The wreath looks AWESOME.  it took us about 2 hours to get it all put together.  We drank pomengrante tea and listened to Cuban music while crafting. It was a lot of fun.  I want us now to make a wreath out of evergreens for our front door.

Ck and I are going to eat dinner at a Thai restaurant tonight. I'm super excited.  I love Thai food!!!  We haven't gone out on a dinner date in a long time.

Need to finish up my Christmas cards and mail them out.  I usually have them all finished by now. 

There is a light dusting of snow outside right now on the ground.  It looks so pretty, but is sadly melting away as I type.
